intro: Crudia dewitii, commonly known as the Cape dewberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly serrated edge. Crudia dewitii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
